values:
Well, 
Today is shaping up to be the toughest, scariest and saddest birthdays I've ever had. Or any day period. I feel like the floor is dropping out on me. I have no choice but to give the control of my life back to God for the first time in years. I know I'm just your average christian hypocrite for waiting to turn back to my true relationship with God until He was all I had left, but that's the long and short of it.
After years of saying it, I'm finally willing to let it go and start treating my faith as what it is: A personal relationship with God. Not  a way of dressing or a certain translation of the bible, or condemming others and finding fault but simply a One-on-one relationship between me and God that takes thought and time to build just like any other relationship.
There are lot of things I am pleading with him about right now and a lot of direction he's been giving me from unexpected places. I never thought He'd give me a miracle, but He has in how He's changing me. Maybe it isn't too late for more.
I'm sure to whomever stumbles on this it may not make a lot of sense, but those of you who know me just keep me in your thoughts and prayers.

Thanks

You scored as Hoban 'Wash' Washburne. The Pilot. You are a leaf on the wind, see how you soar. You have a good job, and a stunning wife who loves you (and can kill people). Life is good, which is why you can't help smiling. Now if you can just get people to actually listen to your opinion things would be perfect.

Not much to update here right now, work is interesting this week. Lots of poo hitting the fan, and the rest of the poo is standing in line waiting patiently for it's turn through the blades of death. There is only so long that people can put up with things going like this at work, and I don't know how long that'll be.  It's all I can do to try and keep my mind on task and my temper in check for 8 hours till I can get home and do something mindless, but that has it's problems too. As somebody I respect a lot pointed out to me I haven't been doing a great job following through on putting together a budget and I've been feeling the effects of that. I just need to find a day when I can focus long enough to sit down in a chair and type it up.

On a slightly more interesting note, I ran across this story today. http://www.technovelgy.com/ct/Science-Fiction-News.asp?NewsNum=424 Odd shot in the dark, or the wave of the future? You tell me. Either way, it's a bit scary.  I get the feeling that within the next 20 years humans are going to have some powers we aren't morally equipped to deal with in a beneficial way. Come to think of it, it's probably been that way for a while now anyway. Back in the dark ages mankind was sort of in a 'padded cell' so to speak. Yeah, we could go to war and kill a lot of people, but nobody had the ability to pretty much wipe out mankind as a whole the way we can now with nuclear power and biological weapons. And when you throw things like being able to 'predict' crimes, and genetic modification etc into the mix things get a wee bit freaky all of a sudden.

Just saw AVP tonight on DVD. It was in fullscreen, which was minorly annoying but all-in-all it was a much better movie than I expected. I started out jokingly predicting who was going to die first (Hint: the guy who shows off a picture of his kids in the first 15 minutes always gets killed later on) but then I realised: It's a sci-fi action thriller, all but one person dies. High art it isn't, but at least it has that much in common with Shakespears' tragedies.
It would have been mediocre at best but good effects and some nice twists in the third act made it worth the watch.

I've been reading up on the new Xbox 360, and let me just say right now that the new incarnation of xbox live will probably be looked back on as one of the milestones of change in the culture of connectivity.  It looks as though you'll be able to carry on voice and videochat with anybody else who has 360 and the proper gear. There will also be pay-as you go downloadable media content. Ultimately, Microsofts' bid to bring the internet out of the office and into the entertainment room may start a pretty fundamental shift in our media habits.

I used to read a magazine called "NASA Tech briefs" it was basically a compilation of articles on the latest gagetry that NASA has devised. I stopped reading cause I couldn't understand any of it without a dictonary, an understanding of the finer points of electrical engineering and some sort of degree in higher math. Does anybody else find it ironic that we are grounding the shuttle because nobody can figure out how to keep pieces from falling off of it?

Yep, I'm still alive incase anybody was worried. (doubtful, I know.)
Thing went great on the trip, it was a wonderful experience, it's going to take me a while to process it all.
Tomorrow half the office is off to a shoot in Adrian so I'm getting ready for that. Packing clothes for the next 3 days and whatnot.
So far, this week has been great. Yesterday started and ended very well.
Well, I'm heading for bed. I'll tell ya all about Africa soon, I promise. (You'll all be bored to tears when I get done, I'm sure. Muahahaaahahauau!)

well, amazingly we found a internet cafe out here in the middle of nowhere basically. I don't have enought time to write a big post, but I'll fill ya all in when i get home.
things are going great. it's not ALL that hot right now either, and that is nice. peace out, ya'all!

Well, I figured I had better update this thing before I vacate the country. I'm in major stressing mode right now, having nothing packed yet and all that. Trying to start adjusting my sleep schedule so as to not be a total zombie when we arrive in the new time zone so I'm going to try and go to bed at like, 8 pm. (yeah, right. I'm just gonna lay awake till midnight anyway.)
I got a International driver's license today as a second form of I.D. wee! I can cause havok on the roads of the world now! Just kidding, I'm actually a safe driver...unlike what some people might tell you ;-)

Well, 
The Battery in my car finally gave up the ghost, so dad was nice enough to pick up a new one for me and drive all the way out to holland to help me install it, in the freezing snow :-)
I'm finally over this darn cold for the most part. For some reason, I've started having some back spasms though.
It's all good, I actually got out of the house and the office on tuesday night, and somebody special showed me a really nice little coffee house. 
(By the way....Coffee at 8:30 at night WILL make you hyper :-))
Yikes...I'm leaving in less than two weeks! Pack! I must Pack!

Well, I'm finally crawling out from under the cloud of sickness that's been following me around all week...At least it was only a bad cold and not the flu.
So, some sorta big news...apparently work is sending me to africa(!) to help the production team shoot some stuff. Like AFRICA! as in, it's warm and the sun is out and all that stuff. Oh yeah, then there's the shots...I got a couple of them today, with about 4 more to be done on monday. And malaria pills too. The thing is, most of the shots need to be taken 4-6 weeks ahead in order to be effective...and we are leaving on the 23'rd, so that makes me a little bit nervous.
I went to Miejer photo to get some photo's for my visa....no such luck, thier camera was busted. Anyhoo, thought i might see some friends I know that work there,  but no such luck. Ended up going to Wallgreens for the pics. bleh.

Well folks, I'm finally updating again. So it's finally snowing outside. Anybody else find it amazing that we have made it into january without blizzard yet? 
Went to see ROTK with the family on saturday. The movie was even better the second time. (Hmm...better go again)
I also finally saw "The League of extraordinary Gentlemen" this week. Fun movie.

Well, Christmas was good. Got some cool stuph. And candy, I got lot's of candy. Auuuu...I CAN'T STOP EATING SKITTLES! I got a whole 16 oz bag of them for Christmas and I CAN'T stop munching on them, I'm an addict with a 3-day sugar buzz to prove it. 
Went to see Peter Pan with some of me friends. Good times where had by all, at least I hope so. My car, uh required a jump however. Yeah, so I have a little problem remembering to turn my lights off....GGGGrrrr. But thanks to those who sacrificed comfort and health to stand out in the freezing cold and help start my car. I owe you one.

Yesss!!! Christmas is this week. To my friends in the retail career...hang on the crazyness is almost over.
This is sooooo bad. Paycheck, Peter Pan, and ROTK will all be in theatres this week...and there's no way I can afford to see them all :-( paycheck looks like a good one to see on DVD later on, so I geuss I could skip that one but peter pan and lord of the rings where both HUGE favorite stories of mine when I was little, so I'm saving my pennies for those. 
Ok, I'm gonna clean my room now. Or maybe I'll just pile everything on my bed...

There once was a Who lived in a .

The was becuase was causing great problems. the didn't know what to do, so decided to to see if that would help. It did, and everyone lived

SO, we decorated our Christmas tree today. Even with all the lights and whatnot, it's still a saaaad looking tree, in my honest opinion. I bought the last few christmas presents I needed to get today, and boy was 28th street a madhouse. :-( I meant to stop and say 'hi' some friends at Miejer®, but Mel was apparently deep in the bowels of the system somwhere and I never saw her. Hope you made it out alive! Kendra, you looked like you where having a lot of fun working the lane...next time I'll stop and say hi, promise.

Thanks to the person who is responsable for all the pretty colors on here! HTML is soooo coool. ;-) and I am soooo bored.

Mood:

Still kinda tired... didn't get much of anything done at work today.
So it turns out that there really is such a thing as lake effect snow. 
Right now I'm just trying to figure out the soonest I can go see ROTK again. Anybody else going?
Alright, I'm gonna go collapse in bed. Everyone have a great weekend.

Man...I am SO tired and I really shouldn't be. I feel like crud, I hope I'm not getting sick.
Nothing really happened today that I can remember well enought to talk about here...geuss I'll go to bed. Goodnight all.

Things I learned early wednesday morning:

I Learned that you can spout cheesy one-liners and still be loved and adored by all the girls, as long as you are Orlando Bloom in pointy ears.

I learned that a three hour movie can seem too long and way too short at the same time.

I learned that 2 coffees, orange soda and fruit punch makes you wish there was an intermission.

I learned that ROTK ROCKS!!!

I learned that IHOP is open at 4 am, but they aren't used to serving 6 nerdy LOTR fans and random drunks at that time of the morning.

Did I mention that Return of the King is awesome?

I learned that when IHOP is understaffed at 4 am, they let patrons answer their phones, and serve other customers.

I learned that some people are very hyper the next day, if they haven't had any sleep.

I learned that my car is terrible on the snow.

I learned to hide my keys.

I learned to listen to my intuition. (ask me about it, the story's not as deep as you might imagine.)

I learned that it's great to have friends.

Our family tried a different church today. They meet later in the day so I didn't have to get up till 11 am. Yay!
I've had a cell phone for about 2 months, and lost two chargers already. Yeah, so if anybody tries to call my phone is dead. at least till I pick up a (third) charger tomorrow night. Grrr.
And to Keagan and Andrew regarding my kicking their butts at SOF II on multiplayer last night I say: It's about freaking time!

So, we tromped outside today to bag our Chrismas tree. It seems that though we have a chainsaw, you need gas to run it and we where a little short of that....despite dads' trying to siphon some from out of our truck. Note to self:apparently, stealing gas isn't as easy as it looks. So, I cut down the tree with the handsaw. Enter problem number two. Sidenote: Ever notice how things outdoors tend to look small until you try and stick them in your living room? Yeah...so it seems a ten foot tree won't fit in a room with a nine foor ceiling. Enter the saw. walla, nine foot tree, nine foot ceiling, everybody happy. Oh...but why does the tree look as if someone hacked off the top of it?

Just got back from watching "The Last Samurai" Good movie! Awesome swordfighting stuff. Waaaaa....I wish I was that good. *Sniff*
Well, it inspired me to stop slacking off and actually PRACTICE. Anywoo, Ring Of Steel is Tommorrow, So it's all good because I'll get 3 solid hours of practice time in.
We are cutting down a Christmas tree tomorrow. Usually for our family, finding the 'right' tree is a complex process that involves walking around in the cold and examining every tree avialable, and comparing their relative merits. (much like shoe shopping with a woman, only with frostbite.) This year however, we opted to take a tree from our property, so things will be much simpler. We even get to use a chainsaw.
Well, Everyone have a great weekend! Andrew, We'll hafta play some video games this weekend. Yay!

Did I ever mention the fact that I hate rain? why can't we just get it over with and dump a blizzard on us. Uh, I take that back, no blizzard please! Every year I tell myself I'm gonna learn to snowboard....well not this year, this year I know it not gonna happen.
In a feeble attempt to feel better about living in this wet, cold state of ours, I've written this little list:

**The Top Ten Reasons Michigan is Better Than Hawaii**

10. No active volcanoes.

9. Doing donuts on the highway is fun.

8. Hurricanes? what are those?

7. Wearing little grass skirts and flower necklaces gets old.

6. If you live in Hawaii, where do you vacation to?

5. Pineapple juice drinking fountains stink when you're really thirsty.

4. It's great not mowing the grass 4 months out of the year.

3. Traveling out of state doesn't cost 999.99 round trip. And we can buy the little bags of salty peanuts at walmart anyway.

2. It's fun to laugh at crazy drivers just after the first snow of the year. 

And THE NUMBER ONE REASON MICHIGAN IS BETTER.....

1. Um......yeah, riiiiiiight.

Man, I have to say that I'm happy it hasn't snowed yet. Not looking forward to an hour drive both ways to work every day in the snow. Yeah.
I finally "cleaned" my room AKA, stuffed things in boxes and drawers. Yes, to normal people my room looks messy now, but if you had seen it before...well.
Wee! ROTK is coming soon! and I gots tickets! *does happy dance* Celebration Cinema. 12:01 on the 17th. Theatre 3.

You're goin' down! FOR HACKING INTO COMPUTERS!

What Would You Go to Jail For? (Many outcomes)
brought to you by Quizilla LOL, Code and I are both going to jail for hacking I geuss. Are you kidding? I've never nor would i ever actually hack illegally (Notice I said ILLEGALLY. There are plenty of fun LEGAL things you can do though.) Well, This weekend turned out to be really really cool and a lot of fun. But yikes, monday is coming FAST. Well, have a good one Y'all.

woah. I can't belive I was up till four am and I'm out of bed at ten and hyper. went to tim's b-day partay. ummm, dude never use a po-tay-toe cannon that has been sitting in your car and is frozen...it will break. Yeah.
Yay! somebody else actually likes the movie Uncle Nino! 
Hmm....Don't disturb me, I'm thinking of car names. Hmmm.... 
Fun times. well, I gots to go eat some food, okee?

Thing have been really really shitty the last few days.....
But I WILL look at the glass as being half full. I will i will i will.  ok, nuff of this crap, the glass is NOT half full, OK? Moving on, I went to see the premiere of a cool movie the other night called "Uncle Nino" it's playing at celebration cinema, but only for this week unless people go see it so, GO SEE IT! It's an Independant film so they are depending on word of mouth and such to get people to see the movie. anyhows, I'll prolly go agian, so ifin' anybody wants to go, lemme know!

Not much too say about today. Sometimes it was good, sometimes it sucked. but mostly it was cold, windy and lonely. Or random.


How random are you?
this quiz was made by alanna

Well here I am on the computer, even though I'm desperately trying to clean my room. Really, I am, I just can't concentrate long enough to get it done. Music! think I'll play some music, maybe that will help. Updates as events warrant.

Thanksgiving rocks. Good food, a day off to relax, leftover punkin' pie.
In other news, St. Louis is (In my humble opinion) a lame town. If they didn't have the arch, I venture to guess that nobody would even visit there. Ok, so it's not nearly as bad as I make it sound. The view from my hotel was really cool though, I was on the 22nd floor right across the street from the arch so I could look straight across and see it at night.

Sorry I haven't updated in forever. Last wednesday work shipped me off to St. louis. They gave me almost 24 hours notice. Doncha love it? It was a good time though. Well, time for eating turkey with the family, i'll update agian soon.

1. Ever been so drunk you blacked out: Not likely
2. Ever broke someone's heart? I hope not.
3. Put a part of your body on fire for amusement: does it count if it was an accident? 
4. Been hurt emotionally: Yeah
5. Kept a secret from everyone: Yes
6. Had an imaginary friend when you were young: You bet!
7. Wanted to hook up with a friend: Yeah
8. Had a crush on a teacher: homeschooled so, NOPE
9. Ever thought an animated character was hot: Not so much, no.
10. Had a New Kids On the Block tape: Who?
11. What was the last new movie you saw: "Brother Bear" Cool moose, aye?
--RIGHT NOW--------- 
1. Wearing: jeans, t-shirt, my shirt with the the metal eagle on it.
2. Hair Is: on my head
3. Eating: gum
4. Drinking: that reminds me, I'm thirsty!
5. Thinking about: Sleeeeeeepy time.
6. Talking to: Myself
7. Listening to: the fan in my computer
-------LAST 24 HOURS-------------
1. Cried?: no 
2. Worn a Skirt: Ha Ha, not this week, no
3. Met Someone New: never
4. Cleaned A Room: Riiiiight
5. Done laundry: no
6. Drove a Car: Sir Regal the Beaglemobile
------DO YOU BELIEVE IN------- 
1. Yourself: sometimes
2. Your friends: one or two
3. Santa Claus: sadly, no
4. Tooth Fairy: sure! she gave me a quarter once!
5. Destiny/Fate: free will
6. Angels: yes
7. Ghosts: naw
8. UFO's: if you see it flying, and you can't identify it, it's a ufo, right?
-----RIGHT NOW----- 
1. Who have you known the longest of your "current" friends? Hmm....
2. Who's the loudest?: ben 
3. Who do you go to for advice: depends
4. Who do you cry to?: nobody
5. Worst feeling: lonliness
6. Who will respond to this the fastest? dunno
7. Who did you send this to that will not reply: didn't send it anywhere
8. Who sent this to you? nobody, I STOLE it from Kendra on LJ

Feeling a little down today, not sure why exactly...must be all the depressing music I listen to. I better stop it soon, I'm getting the urge to wear only black clothes. *Sigh*, only 4 more months of frigid michigan weather :-(
Anybody else see the eclipse last night? Very cool, I must say. Nothing of interest happening really, I'm going out of town for a shoot next week. Not any farther south, unfortunately but hey, free hotel and free food so I can't complain.

Well, tomorrow is officaily when the bannanas hit the fan. We start production on this project at seven AM. For such a big shoot, there sure are a lot of things that have to come together at the last minute to make this work. yikers

GRRRRR! 
Our house has been invaded by ladybugs. *#!&* things are ticking me off. Die you disgusting little pests! (but go outside to do it, won't you?)
Ok, done yelling now.
I've been spending a lot of time prepping for a shoot next week. I'm the art director, and that basically means shopping for props and such. In this case it means shopping for stuffed animals and doll furniture...talk about getting weird looks. I think I'll go wonder off and play with power tools or something.

Wow, I'm actualy updating TWO DAYS IN A ROW!
I've been working on a funeral video at work...depressing. And I'm panicking becuase I'm also the Art Director for a shoot that's coming up, and I still have a TON of props to get pulled together. OK, NO MORE VENTING. AAAAUURRRRGGGH. *ahem* sorry. Moving on to other matters, I like your new icon Kendra, it's cool.
Yay! matrix comes out next week!!!!

Yay for an extra hour of sleep...I needed it too, out late at a party. good times where had by all. Thanx for the invite dude! Dasies! matrix three is out in a matter of days! Yes! 
Well, I have to get back to writing something I've been putting off...siiiigh

Ok, my friend made me promise to post this in here, so here it is:

Sum up your opinion or impression of me in one word, leave it as a comment in this posting, and then post this sentence in your own diary.

There is such a thing as a free lunch...I had one today, compliments of where I work. :-) Almost made up for the rest of the day.
Detours SUCK. The constant construction between here and the office has made me a reble. I now drive through on "closed" roads without a second thought, and I haven't seen any construction workers anywhere. If I fly off an unbuilt bridge someday soon you'll know why.
Siiigh....I miss summer.  *sniff*

#%#* I updated, but the blamed website lost it. AURGGG. 
ANYWAYS. Today was good, I got to spend some time outside reading and soaking up what little warmth I could from the sun. 'Scuse me while I move closer to the equator.
I went to the Ring of Steel meeting on friday (stage combat club) It was cool. I now have my very own boukin (a wooden practice sword, only they call them 'props') So far, all I know how to do is twirl it and look menacing...ok, so I still have to work on the "menacing" part of it.

Today was a mix of being really great, and really crappy. Stupid Michigan weather sux. Lets all move to California, dangint. 
Arg, I hate it when I have to drink liquid caffein to stay awake in the morning...gives me a headache at night.

wow...I haven't updated in forever.
Things have been really disorienting in my life lately. So many changes. I can't keep up with it all, I just want to sit and not do much of anything.
Atlanta was great, though I'm glad to be back in Michigan. I'm just dreading the thought of being buried in snow for 3 months. Where the heck did the summer get off to in such a hurry?

"Speed Hump, two sets"--a road sign in Atlanta.  I don't know why that stuck me as something worth typing here, but at 5 am, a lot of things I see strike me as funny. You have to admit thier choice of verbage is...odd.
Finally got some downtime to update this thing. It seems that in the department I'm working with on set, 16 hour days are par for the course. Sanity, where for art thou? all told though, it's killer down here. Atlanta is a cool town and working on set is awesome. This production is so much bigger than anything I've been on before...it's hard to even describe except to say that it's crazy.

Well, Here I am in bonny atlanta...turns out they have computers in this here hotel (and we have a kitchen too :-) coolness!
It's five AM, and I'm just about to leave for my first day on set...yikes!

Well, this it it. Sunday morning at three am, I'm off to Atlanta and I'm as intimidated as hell. There is NO WAY I belong on a real movie set.
Went to see "Pirates" today. LOVED it my new favorite film (After LOTR, of course) I soooo wish I had seen it sooner.
I got myself a cell phone finally. I can already see that I will need to get more minutes.
I locked my keys into my car at the theatre, WITH THE LIGHTS ON. That was just pants, and it took about 3 hours to set everything right agian. DAUAUAUAARRRRGH. Here's to hoping that wasn't an indicator of how the next two weeks will go.
Well, If i don't talk to some of you before I leave, lemme just shout out a "goodye" to you all.

Went to a new church with some friends this morning. We stopped for breakfast at M'cdee's for breakfast. Tried to order through the drive through, but we found out that that works better if you actually STOP at the window to order before you pull ahead to pick up your food. (no, it wasn't me driving)
So this church was ok, but the cool thing is that they serve breakfast and you can eat it in the sanctuary.  Sweetness.
All in all, a very ok day.

Here's a crazy little thing I wrote about my drive home from work last fall.
Lame and stupid, you say? Wait! there's more. I translated it into spanish using bablefish, then back to english. Below is the original piece of tripe, followed by the computer's translation.

THE ORIGINAL:
"For a moment, everything seemed cookie-cutter beautiful. The sun slanted across the road, leaving pools of amber light and warm shadows, defining the shapes of the trees just budding there leaves, some green, some amber brown. The fields were the brilliant color of new growth, and like in a perfect storybook town, at house after house people were crossing the road to pick up their mail after a long days' work. With the perfect choreography born of chance, they moved in unison. And for a moment, I felt sure I must be living in a car commercial."

THE ENGLISH-TO-SPANISH-TO-ENGLISH TRANSLATION
"for a moment, everything looked like the beautiful cake-cutting. The sun inclined through the way, leaving swimming pools of the amber light and the hot shades, defining the forms of the trees hardly that bloom there go. Some green one, certain brown an amber one. The fields were the color shining of the new growth, and like inside a perfect city of storybook, in the house after the people of the house where crossing the way to take they send there after the long days work. With choreography perfect taken of the occasion, they moved in unison. And for a moment, it felt safe I to me I must live in an announcement of the car." 

Even better than the original! (not that THAT would take much..) Instant comedy! I may be onto something here. IF anyone else has any submissions, feel free to post them in a reply to this entry.
